info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 03 at 11:27PM CDT until June 03 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN GLASSCOCK...REAGAN AND SOUTHERN UPTON COUNTIES... At 1127 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 16 miles north of Barnhart to 10 miles southeast of Big Lake to 19 miles southeast of Rankin, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Big Lake, McCamey, Rankin, Reagan County Airport, Stiles, Best and Upton County Airport. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
